lead_paragraph: A few years ago, when I was anxiously trying to read every book ever written on markets and how they go awry, I came across a reviewer on Amazon with a particularly arresting take on the subject. His screen name was "the_carouser," and unlike most of the customers weighing in on these sorts of books, he did not seek to impress others with his catastrophic outlook. He presented himself as a U.K.-based trader who specialized in "fading market panics," and this seemed legitimate. I was so impressed by his point of view that I tried to contact him directly, thinking he might be useful as a source or possibly even a writer.
